author: Kazuo Ueda
title: Japan's economy and monetary policy
Key quote: The Bank considers that, if underlying inflation rises in line with its outlook, it will be appropriate to accordingly raise the policy interest rate and adjust the degree of monetary accommodation.
Rationale: Governor Ueda's speech indicates a clear bias toward raising interest rates if underlying inflation continues to rise towards the 2% target, reflecting a somewhat hawkish stance as the Bank of Japan has already raised rates recently.
description: Speech by Mr Kazuo Ueda, Governor of the Bank of Japan, at a meeting with business leaders, Osaka, 24 September 2024.

author: Kazuo Ueda
title: The Bank's Semiannual Report on Currency and Monetary Control
Key quote: The Bank decided to maintain the current guideline for money market operations during the intermeeting period, in which it would encourage the uncollateralized overnight call rate to remain at around 0 to 0.1 percent.
Rationale: Governor Ueda highlighted moderate economic recovery and maintained the current low policy rate, signaling some dovish sentiment. However, the mention of reducing JGB purchases indicates a cautious approach to tightening, hence the 'somewhat dovish' label and a 'Hold' prediction.
description: Statement by Mr Kazuo Ueda, Governor of the Bank of Japan, before the Committee on Financial Affairs, House of Councillors, Tokyo, 18 June 2024.

author: Kazuo Ueda
title: Opening remarks - BOJ-IMES conference 2024
Key quote: Our primary objective is to achieve 2% inflation in a sustainable and stable manner.
Rationale: The speech reflects a somewhat dovish stance with the termination of unconventional measures due to improving inflation, but emphasizes a careful approach to re-anchor inflation expectations at the 2% target, indicating no immediate move towards tightening.
description: Opening remarks by Mr Kazuo Ueda, Governor of the Bank of Japan, at the 2024 BOJ-IMES Conference "Price Dynamics and Monetary Policy Challenges: Lessons Learned and Going Forward", hosted by the Institute for Monetary and Economic Studies, Tokyo, 27 May 2024.

author: Kazuo Ueda
title: Virtuous cycle between wages and prices and the Bank of Japan's monetary policy
Key quote: It is within sight that the price stability target of 2 percent will be achieved in a sustainable and stable manner.
Rationale: Governor Ueda's speech signals that while Japan is close to achieving its inflation target sustainably, due to changes in firms' wage- and price-setting behaviors, the Bank of Japan plans to maintain accommodative financial conditions. The recent shift in monetary policy framework suggests a cautious approach, indicating a hold on the interest rates for stability until further consistent trends are observed.
description: Speech by Mr Kazuo Ueda, Governor of the Bank of Japan, at a meeting by the Yomiuri International Economic Society, Tokyo, 8 May 2024.

author: Kazuo Ueda
title: On the recent changes in the Bank of Japan's Monetary Policy Framework
Key quote: Based on these factors, we concluded in the March Monetary Policy Meeting that the probability of achieving a stable 2% inflation rate has increased enough to justify the outlined policy normalization.
Rationale: Governor Ueda's speech reflects a recognition of improved inflation dynamics but emphasizes maintaining an accommodative monetary policy stance due to underlying inflation being below the target, suggesting a potential 'hold' in interest rates.
description: Remarks by Mr Kazuo Ueda, Governor of the Bank of Japan, at the Peterson Institute for International Economics, Washington DC, 19 April 2024.

author: Kazuo Ueda
title: The Bank's Semiannual Report on Currency and Monetary Control
Key quote: It anticipates that accommodative financial conditions will be maintained for the time being.
Rationale: Governor Kazuo Ueda suggests ongoing accommodation in monetary conditions due to moderate economic recovery and uncertainties in outlook, thus indicating a somewhat dovish stance favoring holding rates steady.
description: Statement by Mr Kazuo Ueda, Governor of the Bank of Japan, before the Committee on Financial Affairs, House of Representatives, Tokyo, 10 April 2024.

author: Kazuo Ueda
title: Wages and prices - past, present, and future
Key quote: The Bank has patiently continued with monetary easing while striking a balance between its positive effects and side effects.
Rationale: Governor Ueda discusses the improving outlook for Japan's economy and the possibility of achieving the 2% inflation target sustainably, but also highlights that the likelihood is not yet sufficiently high and signals caution over uncertainties. This balanced perspective on the current economic situation indicates a neutral stance, suggesting a hold in policy rates.
description: Speech by Mr Kazuo Ueda, Governor of the Bank of Japan, at the Meeting of Councillors of Keidanren (Japan Business Federation), Tokyo, 25 December 2023.

author: Kazuo Ueda
title: Ueda Kazuo: The Bank's Semiannual Report on Currency and Monetary Control
Key quote: The Bank considers that sustainable and stable achievement of the price stability target is not yet envisaged with sufficient certainty at this point, and that it is important to closely monitor whether a virtuous cycle between wages and prices will intensify.
Rationale: Governor Ueda emphasizes the continuation of monetary easing and expresses caution about achieving the inflation target with certainty. His commitment to maintaining QQE and Yield Curve Control suggests a dovish stance with a likelihood of holding rates steady.
description: Statement by Mr Ueda Kazuo, Governor of the Bank of Japan, before the Committee on Financial Affairs, House of Councillors, Tokyo, 17 November 2023.

author: Kazuo Ueda
title: Ueda Kazuo: Japan's economy and monetary policy
Key quote: The Bank's basic thinking on the conduct of monetary policy is that it will patiently continue with monetary easing under the framework of yield curve control, aiming to support Japan's economic activity and thereby facilitate a favorable environment for wage increases.
Rationale: Governor Ueda's speech highlights a continued commitment to accommodative monetary policy, citing high uncertainties and the need for supporting economic activity until inflation becomes sustainably entrenched around the target. This indicates a somewhat dovish stance with a likelihood of holding rates steady in the near term.
description: Speech by Mr Ueda Kazuo, Governor of the Bank of Japan, at a meeting with business leaders, Nagoya, 6 November 2023.

author: Kazuo Ueda
title: Ueda Kazuo: Central bank finances and monetary policy conduct
Key quote: On the other hand, in Japan, sustainable and stable achievement of the price stability target of 2 percent has not yet come in sight, and there is still a distance to go before reaching the 'exit.'
Rationale: Governor Ueda emphasizes that Japan is still far from achieving its inflation target, suggesting a continuation of the current accommodative policy. The speech focuses on the challenges faced during the exit phase of monetary policy, but does not indicate immediate tightening, leading to the prediction of a 'Hold' on rates.
description: Speech by Mr Ueda Kazuo, Governor of the Bank of Japan, at the 2023 Autumn Annual Meeting of the Japan Society of Monetary Economics, Fukuoka, 30 September 2023.

author: Kazuo Ueda
title: Ueda Kazuo: Old and new challenges for monetary policy
Key quote: Taking the current increase in global inflationary pressure as an example, it has been pointed out that the increase in inflationary pressure has been caused by supply factors such as a rapid rise in commodity prices, labor shortages, and disruptions to supply chains.
Rationale: The speech does not indicate a shift towards either tightening or loosening monetary policy. It acknowledges both old and new challenges for monetary policy but emphasizes the importance of careful analysis, suggesting a cautious approach to policy changes.
description: Opening remarks by Mr Ueda Kazuo, Governor of the Bank of Japan, at the 2023 Bank of Japan and Institute for Monetary and Economic Studies (BOJ-IMES) conference, hosted by the Institute for Monetary and Economic Studies, Tokyo, 31 May 2023.

author: Kazuo Ueda
title: Ueda Kazuo: Basic thinking on monetary policy and the outlook for economic activity and prices
Key quote: The Bank aims to achieve the price stability target of 2 percent in a sustainable and stable manner, accompanied by wage increases. To this end, it is necessary for the Bank to support economic activity by continuing with monetary easing.
Rationale: Governor Ueda emphasizes the importance of maintaining monetary easing to support economic activity and achieve the 2% inflation target sustainably, despite current inflation being above 2%. This indicates a somewhat dovish stance focused on ensuring stable wage growth and economic recovery.
description: Speech by Mr Ueda Kazuo, Governor of the Bank of Japan, at a meeting held by the Naigai Josei Chosa Kai, Research Institute of Japan, Tokyo, 19 May 2023.

author: Shinichi Uchida
title: Japan's economy and monetary policy

The emphasis on raising rates suggests a somewhat hawkish stance, although there is caution given the current economic uncertainties.

author: Shinichi Uchida
title: Price dynamics in Japan over the past 25 years

Rationale: The speech focuses on structural inflationary changes and overcoming deflationary norms, suggesting patience with the current accommodative monetary policy despite some recent inflationary pressures. There is no indication that a rate change is imminent, thus it's likely the central bank would 'Hold' rates at the next meeting.
description: Keynote speech by Mr Shinichi Uchida, Deputy Governor of the Bank of Japan, at the 2024 BOJ-IMES Conference, hosted by the Institute for Monetary and Economic Studies, Tokyo, 27 May 2024.

author: Shinichi Uchida
title: Japan's economy and monetary policy

author: Shinichi Uchida

author: Naoki Tamura

There is recognition of economic recovery and inflationary forces starting to align with targets, but still an emphasis on maintaining current policy conditions.

author: Naoki Tamura

The focus is on monitoring the virtuous cycle between wages and prices rather than immediate policy rate changes.

author: Junko Nakagawa
